text.p: - Rauscher Pierce Refsnes Inc said Thursday it initiated coverage of Excel Communications Inc with a market performer rating.

- Analyst Harry Blount said in a news release the long-distance telephone company has increased revenues to $1.3 billion in 1996 from $30.8 million in 1993, with most growth driven by its multi-level marketing network.

- Although Blount said the growth rate has slowed over the last three quarters and is expected to do so again in 1997, he believes the company can generate compounded revenue growth of 43 percent over the next three years.
- In addition, Blount sees year-over-year growth rate of earnings per share comparisons slowing at least through the third quarter of 1997, resulting in the market performer rating.
